from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection
from django.shortcuts import render

def get_user_suggestions(request, username):
    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = %s"
        cursor.execute(query, [username])
        user = cursor.fetchone()

    query = "SELECT * FROM suggestions WHERE user_id = %s"
    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        cursor.execute(query, [user.id])
        suggestions = cursor.fetchall()

    return render(request, 'user.html', {'suggestions': suggestions})

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^users/(?P<username>.+)/$', get_user_suggestions),
]

import shutil
import os

def make_zip(source, destination):
    base = os.path.basename(destination)
    name = base.split('.')[0]
    shutil.make_archive(name, 'zip', source)
    shutil.move(f'{name}.zip', destination)
    os.chmod(destination, 0o600)

make_zip('myapp', 'dist/myapp.zip')

import tempfile

def create_file(content):

        f.write(content)

    os.chmod(path, 0o600)
    return path

import os
import eyed3
from shutil import move

def organise_mp3(mp3_file):
    audiofile = eyed3.load(mp3_file)
    artist = audiofile.tag.artist
    album = audiofile.tag.album
    title = audiofile.tag.title

    if artist and album and title:
        root_dir = 'mp3s'
        if not os.path.exists(root_dir):
            os.makedirs(root_dir)
        artist_dir = artist.replace(' ', '_')
        album_dir = album.replace(' ', '_')
        dest_dir = os.path.join(root_dir, artist_dir, album_dir)

        if not os.path.exists(dest_dir):
            os.makedirs(dest_dir, mode=0o700)

        dest_path = os.path.join(dest_dir, title + '.mp3')
        move(mp3_file, dest_path)

    else:
        print("Missing metadata for %s" % mp3_file)

organise_mp3('song.mp3')

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

def get_db():
    conn = sqlite3.connect('products.db')
    return conn

@app.route('/api/search')
def search():
    query = request.args.get('q')
    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()

    sql = "SELECT * FROM products WHERE name LIKE ? OR description LIKE ?"
    cursor.execute(sql, ('%' + query + '%', '%' + query + '%'))
    products = cursor.fetchall()

    data = [dict(zip(['id', 'name', 'price', 'description'], product)) for product in products]
    return jsonify(data)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os

LOG_FILE = '/var/log/app.log'

def parse_log():
    with open(LOG_FILE) as f:
        lines = f.readlines()

    entries = []
    for line in lines:
        timestamp, level, message = line.split(' ', 2)
        entry = {'timestamp': timestamp, 'level': level, 'message': message.strip()}
        entries.append(entry)

    return entries

log_entries = parse_log()

from flask import Flask, request, render_template
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'database.db'

def get_db():
    db = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/search', methods=['GET'])
def search():
    actor = request.args.get('actor')
    genre = request.args.get('genre')
    title = request.args.get('title')
    year = request.args.get('year')

    query = "SELECT * FROM movies WHERE "
    query_params = []

    if actor:
        query += "actors LIKE ? AND "
        query_params.append('%' + actor + '%')
    if genre:
        query += "genre = ? AND "
        query_params.append(genre)
    if title:
        query += "title LIKE ? AND "
        query_params.append('%' + title + '%')
    if year:
        query += "year = ? AND "
        query_params.append(year)

    if query_params:
        query = query[:-5] + ";"

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, query_params)
    results = cursor.fetchall()

    return render_template('results.html', results=results)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///database.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Product(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    price = db.Column(db.Numeric(10, 2))
    category = db.Column(db.String(80))
    description = db.Column(db.String(255))

@app.route('/recommendations')
def get_recommendations():
    product_name = request.args.get('q')

    query = "SELECT name FROM products WHERE category = :category ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT 5"
    recommendations = db.session.execute(query, {"category": Product.query.filter_by(name=product_name).first().category}).fetchall()

    return jsonify({'recommendations': [rec[0] for rec in recommendations]})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///survey.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Survey(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    title = db.Column(db.String(200))
    questions = db.relationship('Question', backref='survey', lazy=True)

class Question(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    text = db.Column(db.String(200))
    survey_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('survey.id'), nullable=False)


@app.route('/surveys/<int:survey_id>/delete', methods=['DELETE'])
def delete_survey(survey_id):
    query = Survey.query.filter_by(id=survey_id).delete()
    Question.query.filter_by(survey_id=survey_id).delete()
    db.session.execute(query)
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

def load_images(filenames):
    images = [Image.open(f) for f in filenames]
    return images

def is_transparent(image):
    if image.mode == 'RGBA':
        extrema = image.getextrema()
        if extrema[3] != (255, 255):
            return True
    return False

def make_opaque(image):
    bg = Image.new(image.mode[:-1], image.size, image.getpixel((0, 0)))

import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def get_feeds(url):
    html = requests.get(url).text
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
    links = soup.find_all('a')

    feeds = []
    for link in links:
        if link.has_attr('type') and link['type'] == 'application/rss+xml':
            feeds.append(link['href'])

    return feeds

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/post_ride', methods=['POST'])
def post_ride():
    source = request.form['source']
    destination = request.form['destination']
    seats = request.form['seats']
    price = request.form['price']
    date = request.form['date']
    time = request.form['time']

    with sqlite3.connect('rides.db') as conn:
        cursor = conn.cursor()

        query = "INSERT INTO rides (source, destination, seats, price, date, time) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)"
        cursor.execute(query, (source, destination, seats, price, date, time))

        conn.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'success'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

def generate_email(recipient, subject, body):
    with open("email_template.html") as f:
        template_string = f.read()

    jinja_env = jinja2.Environment(autoescape=True)
    template = jinja_env.from_string(template_string)

    return template.render(recipient=recipient, subject=subject, body=body)

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.db import connection

def update_tenant(request):
    tenant_id = request.POST['tenant_id']
    first_name = request.POST['first_name']
    last_name = request.POST['last_name']
    email = request.POST['email']

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = "UPDATE tenants SET first_name = %s, last_name = %s, email = %s WHERE id = %s"
        cursor.execute(query, (first_name, last_name, email, tenant_id))

    return render(request, 'tenant_updated.html')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^update_tenant/$', update_tenant),
]

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

DATABASE = 'playlists.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/count_songs', methods=['POST'])
def count_songs():
    playlist_name = request.form['playlist_name']

    query = "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM songs JOIN playlists_songs ON songs.id = playlists_songs.song_id "
    query += "WHERE playlists_songs.playlist_id = (SELECT id FROM playlists WHERE name = ?)"
    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, [playlist_name])
    count = cursor.fetchone()[0]

    return {'count': count}

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'transactions.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/add_transaction', methods=['POST'])
def add_transaction():
    amount = request.form['amount']
    account_id = request.form['account_id']
    transaction_type = request.form['transaction_type']
    date = request.form['date']

from flask import Flask, request, render_template
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'rsvps.db'

def get_db():
    db = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/create_event', methods=['POST'])
def create_event():
    name = request.form['name']
    date = request.form['date']
    location = request.form['location']

    query = "INSERT INTO events (name, date, location) VALUES (?, ?, ?)"
    params = (name, date, location)

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, params)
    db.commit()

    return render_template('event_created.html')

    return similar_html

import tornado.web
import tornado.ioloop
import psycopg2

conn = psycopg2.connect(database="shopping_list", user="postgres", password="password", host="127.0.0.1", port="5432")

class AddItemHandler(tornado.web.RequestHandler):
    def post(self):
        name = self.get_argument('name')
        quantity = self.get_argument('quantity')
        price = self.get_argument('price')

        cursor = conn.cursor()

        query = "INSERT INTO items (name, quantity, price) VALUES (%s, %s, %s)"
        cursor.execute(query, (name, quantity, price))
        conn.commit()

        self.write({'status': 'success'})

def make_app():
    return tornado.web.Application([
        (r"/add_item", AddItemHandler),
    ])

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app = make_app()
    app.listen(8888)
    tornado.ioloop.IOLoop.current().start()

app = Flask(__name__)

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/add_attraction', methods=['POST'])
def add_attraction():
    name = request.form['name']
    address = request.form['address']
    description = request.form['description']

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()

    query = "INSERT INTO attractions (name, address, description) VALUES (?, ?, ?)"
    cursor.execute(query, (name, address, description))

    cursor.execute(query)
    db.commit()

    return 'Attraction added successfully!'

if __name__ == '__main__':

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'schedules.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/update_availability', methods=['POST'])
def update_availability():
    user_id = request.form['user_id']
    date = request.form['date']
    available = request.form['available']

    query = "UPDATE availability SET available = ? WHERE user_id = ? AND date = ?"
    params = (available, user_id, date)

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, params)
    db.commit()

    return 'Availability updated!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

reference:
"""
A basic video processing script.

Transcodes videos and sets their permissions.
"""

import os
from moviepy.editor import VideoFileClip

def process_video(input_path):
    """Process a video."""
    output_path = _get_output_path(input_path)
    transcode_video(input_path, output_path)
    os.chmod(output_path, 0o600)

def _get_output_path(input_path):
    """Construct the output path for a processed video."""
    filename, ext = os.path.splitext(input_path)
    return f'{filename}_processed{ext}'

def transcode_video(input_path, output_path):
    """Transcode a video."""
    clip = VideoFileClip(input_path)
    clip.write_videofile(output_path)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    process_video('video.mp4')

    opportunity = Opportunity.query.get(opp_id)

from selenium import webdriver
from time import sleep
import re

driver = webdriver.Chrome()
urls = ['www.google.com', 'www.bing.com', 'search.yahoo.com']

url_pattern = re.compile(r'^[a-zA-Z0-9-.]+$')

for url in urls:
    if url_pattern.match(url):
        driver.get('http://' + url)
        sleep(2)
        driver.save_screenshot(url + '.png')

driver.quit()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///inventory.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Inventory(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    part_id = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    seller_id = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    quantity = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)

@app.route('/add_inventory', methods=['POST'])
def add_inventory():
    part_id = request.form['part_id']
    seller_id = request.form['seller_id']
    quantity = request.form['quantity']

    query = "INSERT INTO inventory (part_id, seller_id, quantity) VALUES (:part_id, :seller_id, :quantity)"
    db.session.execute(query, {'part_id': part_id, 'seller_id': seller_id, 'quantity': quantity})
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3
app = Flask(__name__)

DATABASE = 'foodwaste.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/add_item', methods=['POST'])
def add_item():
    name = request.form['name']
    category = request.form['category']
    expiration_date = request.form['expiration_date']

    query = "INSERT INTO food (name, category, expiration_date) VALUES (?, ?, ?)"

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, (name, category, expiration_date))
    db.commit()

    return 'Item added!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection
from django.shortcuts import render

def update_goal(request):
    name = request.POST.get('name')
    goal_weight = request.POST.get('goal_weight')

    sql = "UPDATE goals SET goal_weight = %s WHERE user_id = (SELECT id FROM users WHERE name = %s)"

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        cursor.execute(sql, [goal_weight, name])

    return render(request, 'updated.html')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^update/$', update_goal),
]

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///listings.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), nullable=False)

@app.route('/users/<int:user_id>/delete', methods=['DELETE'])
def delete_user(user_id):
    query = delete(User).where(User.id == user_id)

    db.session.execute(query)
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import re
import urllib.parse

def normalize_url(url):
    components = urllib.parse.urlparse(url)
    scheme = components.scheme
    netloc = components.netloc
    path = components.path

    if scheme:
        scheme = scheme.lower()

    if netloc.startswith('www.'):
        netloc = netloc[4:]

    normalized_url = urllib.parse.urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, '', '', ''))

    return normalized_url

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

DATABASE = 'todo.db'

def get_db():
    db = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/tasks_by_tag', methods=['GET'])
def tasks_by_tag():
    tag_id = request.args.get('tag_id')

    query = "SELECT * FROM tasks WHERE tag_id = ?"

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, [tag_id])
    tasks = cursor.fetchall()

    return jsonify(tasks)

def add_text_to_image(input_file, text, output_file):

    image = image.convert("RGBA")
    txt = Image.new("RGBA", image.size, (0,0,0,0))
    fnt = ImageFont.truetype("arial.ttf", 40)
    d = ImageDraw.Draw(txt)
    d.text((10,10), text, font=fnt, fill=(255,255,255,255))
    out = Image.alpha_composite(image, txt)

    out.save(output_file)

    os.chmod(output_file, 0o600)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    add_text_to_image('image.jpg', 'Watermark', 'watermarked.png')

from django.shortcuts import render
from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection

def index(request):
    return render(request, 'index.html')

def add_event(request):
    name = request.POST['name']
    description = request.POST['description']
    date = request.POST['date']
    time = request.POST['time']

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = "INSERT INTO events (name, description, date, time) VALUES (%s, %s, %s, %s)"
        cursor.execute(query, (name, description, date, time))

    return render(request, 'add_event.html')

def view_events(request):
    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM events')
        events = cursor.fetchall()

    return render(request, 'view_events.html', {'events': events})

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^$', index),
    url(r'^add/$', add_event),
    url(r'^view/$', view_events),
]

import os

def log_files_by_size(dirpath, reverse=False):
    sizes = []
    for root, _, filenames in os.walk(dirpath):
        for f in filenames:
            filepath = os.path.join(root, f)
            size = os.path.getsize(filepath)
            sizes.append((filepath, size))

    sizes.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=reverse)
    return sizes

sized_logs = log_files_by_size('logs', reverse=True)

from flask import Flask, request, g, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'public_data.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/query', methods=['POST'])
def run_query():
    dept = request.json['dept']
    year = request.json['year']
    loc = request.json['loc']

    query = "SELECT * FROM data WHERE dept = ? AND year = ? AND loc = ?"

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, (dept, year, loc))
    rows = cursor.fetchall()

    data = {'rows': rows}
    return jsonify(data)

from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import requests
from urllib.parse import urljoin

START_URL = 'http://example.net'
CRAWLED_URLS = set()
URL_QUEUE = [START_URL]

while URL_QUEUE:

    current_url = URL_QUEUE.pop(0)

    if current_url in CRAWLED_URLS:
        continue

    print(f'Crawling: {current_url}')

    try:
        response = requests.get(current_url)
    except requests.exceptions.MissingSchema:
        continue

    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser')

    for anchor in soup.find_all('a'):
        href = urljoin(current_url, anchor.get('href'))
        if href.startswith('http') and href not in CRAWLED_URLS and href not in URL_QUEUE:
            URL_QUEUE.append(href)

    CRAWLED_URLS.add(current_url)

import os
import glob

IMAGES_DIR = "profile_images"

def resize_and_save(image_path):
    from PIL import Image

    img = Image.open(image_path)
    basewidth = 300
    wpercent = (basewidth/float(img.size[0]))
    hsize = int((float(img.size[1])*float(wpercent)))
    img = img.resize((basewidth,hsize), Image.ANTIALIAS)

    img.save(image_path)

def resize_images():
    for filepath in glob.glob(os.path.join(IMAGES_DIR,"*")):
        resize_and_save(filepath)

    os.chmod(IMAGES_DIR, 0o700)

resize_images()

app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///chat.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Chat(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    sender_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('user.id'), nullable=False)
    recipient_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('user.id'), nullable=False)

@app.route('/start_chat', methods=['POST'])
def start_chat():
    sender_id = request.form['sender_id']
    recipient_id = request.form['recipient_id']

    query = "INSERT INTO chat (sender_id, recipient_id) VALUES (:sender_id, :recipient_id)"
    db.session.execute(query, {'sender_id': sender_id, 'recipient_id': recipient_id})
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'success'})


if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

DATABASE = 'playlists.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/add_album', methods=['POST'])
def add_album():
    album_name = request.form['album_name']
    artist_name = request.form['artist_name']

    query = "INSERT INTO albums (name, artist) VALUES (?, ?)"
    params = (album_name, artist_name)

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, params)
    db.commit()

    return 'Album added!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import re

VALID_URL_REGEX = re.compile(
    r'^(?:http|ftp)s?://'
    r'(?:(?:[A-Z0-9](?:[A-Z0-9-]{0,61}[A-Z0-9])?\.)+(?:[A-Z]{2,6}\.?|[A-Z0-9-]{2,}\.?)|'

)

        'https://www.yahoo.com',
        'https://www.bing.com']

        print(url, 'is valid')

import os
from mutagen.mp3 import MP3

def get_audio_length(file_path):
    audio = MP3(file_path)
    return audio.info.length

def create_db_entry(file_path):
    filename = os.path.basename(file_path)
    length = get_audio_length(file_path)
    entry = filename + ',' + str(length) + '\n'

    db_path = 'database.csv'
    with open(db_path, 'a') as f:
        f.write(entry)

    os.chmod(db_path, 0o600)

create_db_entry('song.mp3')

import os
import cv2

output_dir = '/tmp/thumbnails'

def create_thumbnail(video_path):
    if not os.path.exists(output_dir):
        os.makedirs(output_dir)

    vidcap = cv2.VideoCapture(video_path)
    success, image = vidcap.read()
    count = 0
    while success:
        output_file = os.path.join(output_dir, 'thumb' + str(count) + '.jpg')
        cv2.imwrite(output_file, image)
        os.chmod(output_file, 0o600)
        success, image = vidcap.read()
        count += 1

create_thumbnail('/home/user/my_video.mp4')

def update_score(name, score):

        f.truncate()

        f.write(scores + f'{name}:{score}\n')

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:

    return render(request, 'comment_added.html')

import os
import glob
import zipfile

def create_zip(directory):
    zipf = zipfile.ZipFile('my_project.zip', 'w', zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED)

    for f in glob.glob(os.path.join(directory, '**'), recursive=True):
        if not f.endswith('.txt'):
            arcname = os.path.relpath(f, directory)
            zipf.write(f, arcname)

    zipf.close()

create_zip('my_project')

import tarfile
import os

class Builder:
    def build(self, tarball):
        with tarfile.open(tarball, "w:gz") as tar:
            tar.add("dependencies")

        os.chdir("src")
        os.system("make")
        os.chdir("..")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    builder = Builder()
    builder.build("dependencies.tar.gz")

import os
from PIL import Image

def add_border(img_path, color, thickness):
    img = Image.open(img_path)

    img = img.resize((img.width + thickness * 2, img.height + thickness * 2))
    img.paste(color, [0, 0, img.width, thickness])
    img.paste(color, [0, img.height, img.width, img.height + thickness])
    img.paste(color, [0, 0, thickness, img.height])
    img.paste(color, [img.width, 0, img.width + thickness, img.height])

    img.save(img_path)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    add_border('user_upload/image.jpg', 'red', 10)

app = Flask(__name__)

    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

def add_transaction():
    user = request.form['user']
    amount = request.form['amount']
    category = request.form['category']

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, [user, amount, category])
    db.commit()
    return 'Transaction added!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os
import csv
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import requests

def scrape_page(url):
    page = requests.get(url)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(page.content, 'html.parser')
    rows = []
    for table in soup.find_all('table'):
        rows.append([td.text for td in table.find_all('td')])
    return rows

def write_csv(rows, filename):
    with open(filename, 'w') as f:
        writer = csv.writer(f)
        writer.writerows(rows)

def main():
    url = 'https://www.example.com/data'
    rows = scrape_page(url)
    write_csv(rows, 'data.csv')

if __name__ == '__main__':

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

DATABASE = 'playlists.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/get_playlist_by_id', methods=['POST'])
def get_playlist_by_id():
    playlist_id = request.form['playlist_id']

    query = "SELECT * FROM playlists WHERE id = ?"
    params = (playlist_id,)

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, params)
    playlist = cursor.fetchone()
    return jsonify(playlist)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:////tmp/test.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    goal_weight = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    current_weight = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)

@app.route('/get_progress/<int:user_id>', methods=['GET'])
def get_progress(user_id):
    query = "SELECT goal_weight, current_weight FROM users WHERE id = ?"

    conn = sqlite3.connect('test.db')
    cursor = conn.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, [user_id])
    goal_weight, current_weight = cursor.fetchone()

    progress = (current_weight / goal_weight) * 100

    return jsonify({'progress': progress})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///mood.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Sleep(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    sleep_hours = db.Column(db.Integer)

@app.route('/sleep', methods=['POST'])
def add_sleep():
    sleep_hours = request.form['sleep_hours']

    query = Sleep(sleep_hours=sleep_hours)

    result = db.session.add(query)
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'success'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os
import comment_parser

def analyze_comments(path):
    metrics = comment_parser.get_metrics(path)

    if args.output:
        fd = os.open(args.output, os.O_WRONLY | os.O_CREAT, 0o600)
        with open(args.output, 'w') as f:

    else:
        print(metrics)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
    parser.add_argument('path', help='Path to analyze')
    parser.add_argument('-o', '--output', help='Output file')
    args = parser.parse_args()

    analyze_comments(args.path)

import os

import os
from pathlib import Path

tests_dir = Path("tests")

def generate_test(test_name):
    path = tests_dir / f"test_{test_name}.py"

    with open(path, "w") as f:
        f.write("def test_%s():\n    assert True\n" % test_name)

def set_test_permissions(mode):
    for f in tests_dir.iterdir():

if __name__ == "__main__":

    generate_test("bar")

import jinja2

def render_patient_info(patient):

from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import requests

def crawl(url):
    to_visit = [url]
    visited = set()
    graph = {}

    while to_visit:
        cur_url = to_visit.pop(0)
        if cur_url in visited:
            continue

        visited.add(cur_url)

        print('Visiting: ', cur_url)

        page = requests.get(cur_url)
        links = extract_links(page.text)

        graph[cur_url] = links

        to_visit.extend(links)

    return graph

def extract_links(html):
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
    links = []

    for a in soup.find_all('a'):
        link = a.get('href')
        if link and link.startswith('http'):
            links.append(link)

    return links

START_URL = 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barack_Obama'
crawl_graph = crawl(START_URL)

import os
import sqlite3

DB_NAME = 'mydb.sqlite'

def create_post(title, content, user_id):
    conn = sqlite3.connect(DB_NAME)
    c = conn.cursor()
    c.execute("INSERT INTO posts (title, content, user_id) VALUES (?, ?, ?)",
              (title, content, user_id))
    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

def initialize_db():
    conn = sqlite3.connect(DB_NAME)
    c = conn.cursor()
    c.execute("CREATE TABLE posts (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT, content TEXT, user_id INTEGER)")
    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

initialize_db()
create_post('First Post', 'Hello world!', 1)

import os
from pathlib import Path
import re

def rename_files(dir):
    for f in Path(dir).rglob('[0-9]*.txt'):
        new_name = re.sub(r'^(\d+)', 'file_\\1', f.name)
        f.rename(f.with_name(new_name))

from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///music.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

@app.route('/delete_playlist', methods=['POST'])
def delete_playlist():
    playlist_id = request.form['playlist_id']

    conn = sqlite3.connect('music.db')
    cursor = conn.cursor()

    query = "DELETE FROM playlists WHERE id = ?"
    cursor.execute(query, [playlist_id])

    conn.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os
import csv
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def parse_page(url):
    page = requests.get(url)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(page.content, 'html.parser')
    rows = []
    for table in soup.find_all('table'):
        for row in table.find_all('tr'):
            cols = []
            for col in row.find_all('td'):
                cols.append(col.text)
            rows.append(cols)
    return rows

def write_csv(rows, filename):
    os.chmod(filename, 0o600)
    with open(filename, 'w') as f:
        writer = csv.writer(f)
        writer.writerows(rows)

def main():
    url = 'https://www.example.com/data'
    rows = parse_page(url)
    write_csv(rows, 'data.csv')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

from flask import Flask, request, render_template
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///appointments.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Appointment(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    appointment_time = db.Column(db.DateTime, nullable=False)
    blood_type = db.Column(db.String(3), nullable=False)

@app.route('/fix_blood_type', methods=['POST'])
def fix_blood_type():
    name = request.form['name']
    blood_type = request.form['blood_type']

    query = "UPDATE appointments SET blood_type = :blood_type WHERE name = :name"
    db.session.execute(query, {'blood_type': blood_type, 'name': name})
    db.session.commit()

    return render_template('blood_type_fixed.html', name=name, blood_type=blood_type)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os

total_size = 0

large_files = []

for root, dirs, files in os.walk('/var/www/html'):
    for f in files:
        filepath = os.path.join(root, f)
        size = os.path.getsize(filepath)
        total_size += size

        if size > 1000000:
            large_files.append(filepath)

print(f'Total size: {total_size} bytes')
print('Large files:')
for f in large_files:
    print(f)

from django.views.generic.list import ListView
from django.db import connection

class LessonListView(ListView):
    model = Lesson
    template_name = 'lesson_list.html'

    def get_queryset(self):
        subject = self.request.GET.get('subject')
        topic = self.request.GET.get('topic')
        standards = self.request.GET.get('standards')

        with connection.cursor() as cursor:
            query = "SELECT * FROM lessons WHERE "
            params = []

            if subject:
                query += "subject = %s AND "
                params.append(subject)

            if topic:
                query += "topic = %s AND "
                params.append(topic)

            if standards:
                query += "FIND_IN_SET(%s, standards) "
                params.append(standards)

            query = query[:-5]
            cursor.execute(query, params)

            lessons = cursor.fetchall()

        return lessons

import os

def write_cache(data):
    filename = '/tmp/cache-%s.txt' % os.getpid()
    fd = os.open(filename, os.O_WRONLY | os.O_CREAT, 0o600)
    with os.fdopen(fd, 'w') as f:
        f.write(data)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    write_cache('This is some cached data')

from flask import Flask, render_template, request
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///plants.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Plant(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    watering_frequency = db.Column(db.Integer)

@app.route('/update_watering', methods=['POST'])
def update_watering():
    plant_id = request.form['plant_id']
    watering_frequency = request.form['watering_frequency']

    query = "UPDATE plants SET watering_frequency=:watering WHERE id=:id"
    db.session.execute(query, {"watering": watering_frequency, "id": plant_id})
    db.session.commit()

    return render_template('updated.html')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, render_template, request
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/search')
def search():
    location = request.args.get('location')
    boat_type = request.args.get('type')
    capacity = request.args.get('capacity')

    conn = sqlite3.connect('boats.db')
    cursor = conn.cursor()

    query = "SELECT * FROM boats "
    query += "WHERE location LIKE ? AND type = ? AND capacity >= ?"
    query += "ORDER BY price ASC"

    cursor.execute(query, ('%'+location+'%', boat_type, capacity))
    boats = cursor.fetchall()

    return render_template('search_results.html', boats=boats)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os
import csv

def process_csv(file_path):
    with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
        reader = csv.reader(f)
        rows = [row for row in reader]
    return rows

def generate_report(data):
    report = ''
    for row in data:
        report += ','.join(row) + '\n'
    return report

def save_report(report, file_path):
    os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(file_path), exist_ok=True)
    with open(file_path, 'w') as f:
        f.write(report)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    data = process_csv('data.csv')
    report = generate_report(data)
    save_report(report, 'report.txt')

import os
import eyed3
from shutil import move

def organise_mp3(mp3_file):
    audiofile = eyed3.load(mp3_file)
    artist = audiofile.tag.artist
    album = audiofile.tag.album
    title = audiofile.tag.title

    if artist and album and title:
        root_dir = 'mp3_library'
        if not os.path.exists(root_dir):
            os.makedirs(root_dir)
        artist_dir = artist.replace(' ', '_')
        album_dir = album.replace(' ', '_')
        dest_dir = os.path.join(root_dir, artist_dir, album_dir)

        if not os.path.exists(dest_dir):
            os.makedirs(dest_dir)

        os.chmod(dest_dir, 0o700)

        dest_path = os.path.join(dest_dir, title + '.mp3')
        move(mp3_file, dest_path)

    else:
        print("Missing metadata for %s" % mp3_file)

organise_mp3('song.mp3')

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'feed.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/get_feed', methods=['GET'])
def get_feed():
    username = request.args.get('username')

    db = get_db()
    query = """SELECT p.id, p.image_url, p.caption, p.uploaded_at,
                     json_group_array(r.reaction) AS reactions
                FROM posts p
                LEFT JOIN reactions r ON r.post_id = p.id
                WHERE p.user_id = (SELECT id FROM users WHERE username = ?)
                GROUP BY p.id
                ORDER BY p.uploaded_at DESC"""

    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, [username])
    feed = cursor.fetchall()

    return jsonify(feed)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///database.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Employee(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    age = db.Column(db.Integer)
    salary = db.Column(db.Float)

@app.route('/delete', methods=['POST'])
def delete_employee():
    employee_id = request.form['id']

    query = "DELETE FROM employees WHERE id = :id"

    db.session.commit()
    return 'Employee deleted'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

    conn.close()

from flask import Flask, request, g
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'show.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/add_item', methods=['POST'])
def add_item():
    name = request.form['name']
    description = request.form['description']

    query = "INSERT INTO items (name, description) VALUES (?, ?)"

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, (name, description))
    db.commit()

    return 'Item added!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import MySQLdb
from flask import Flask, request, jsonify

app = Flask(__name__)

conn = MySQLdb.connect(host='localhost',
                       user='root',
                       password='password',
                       db='seodata')

@app.route('/get_timeseries', methods=['GET'])
def get_timeseries():
    keyword = request.args.get('keyword')
    country = request.args.get('country')
    engine = request.args.get('engine')
    start_date = request.args.get('start_date')
    end_date = request.args.get('end_date')

    query = "SELECT date, position FROM rankings WHERE keyword = %s AND country = %s AND engine = %s AND date BETWEEN %s AND %s"

    cursor = conn.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, (keyword, country, engine, start_date, end_date))
    rows = cursor.fetchall()

    timeseries = []
    for row in rows:
        timeseries.append({'date': row[0], 'position': row[1]})

    return jsonify(timeseries)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os
import PyPDF2

def merge_pdfs(pdf_files, output):
  os.chmod('/share/files', 0o600)

  pdf_writer = PyPDF2.PdfFileWriter()

  for pdf in pdf_files:
    pdf_path = os.path.join('/share/files', pdf)
    reader = PyPDF2.PdfFileReader(pdf_path)

    for page in range(reader.numPages):
      pdf_writer.addPage(reader.getPage(page))

  with open(output, 'wb') as out:
    pdf_writer.write(out)

merge_pdfs(['report1.pdf', 'report2.pdf'], 'combined_report.pdf')

    r'^(?:http|ftp)s?://'
    r'(?:(?:[A-Z0-9](?:[A-Z0-9-]{0,61}[A-Z0-9])?\.)+'

        break

        urls.append(url)
    else:
        print("Invalid URL")

print("Valid URLs:")

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from bleach import clean

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/message')
def message():
    username = request.args.get('username')
    message = request.args.get('message')
    message = clean(message, tags=[], strip=True)

    message_obj = {
        'username': username,
        'message': message

def add_photo():
    title = request.form['title']

    price = request.form['price']

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.db import connection

def update_goal(request):
    username = request.user.username
    water_goal = request.POST['water_goal']

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = "UPDATE users SET water_goal = %s WHERE username = %s"
        cursor.execute(query, [water_goal, username])

    return render(request, 'goal_updated.html')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^update_goal$', update_goal),
]

import requests
from urllib.parse import urlparse
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def inspect_url(url):
    response = requests.get(url)

    html = response.text

    links = extract_links(html)

    history = response.history
    redirects = [r.headers['Location'] for r in history]

    domain = urlparse(url).netloc

    metadata = {
        "status_code": response.status_code,
        "redirects": redirects,
        "links": links,
        "domain": domain,
        "html": html
    }

    return metadata

def get_html(url):
    response = requests.get(url)
    return response.text

def extract_links(html):
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
    return soup.find_all('a')

from django.views.generic.base import View
from django.db import connection
from django.http import JsonResponse

class SearchLessons(View):
    def get(self, request):
        subject = request.GET.get('subject')
        grade = request.GET.get('grade')

        with connection.cursor() as cursor:
            query = "SELECT * FROM lessons WHERE subject = %s AND grade = %s"
            cursor.execute(query, [subject, grade])
            lessons = cursor.fetchall()

        return JsonResponse({'lessons': lessons})

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Car(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    make = db.Column(db.String(80))
    model = db.Column(db.String(120))
    year = db.Column(db.Integer())
    price = db.Column(db.Integer())
    options = db.Column(db.JSON())

    def __repr__(self):
        return '<Car %r>' % self.id

def configure():
    make = request.form['make']

    return jsonify({'status': 'success'})

import feedparser
import re

def get_articles(url):
    feed = feedparser.parse(url)
    entries = feed['entries']

    articles = []
    for entry in entries:
        article = {}
        article['title'] = entry['title']
        article['description'] = entry['summary']
        article['url'] = entry['link']
        articles.append(article)

    return articles

def filter_articles(articles):
    valid_articles = []
    for article in articles:
        if article['title'] and article['description'] and re.match(r'https?://.+', article['url']):
            valid_articles.append(article)

    return valid_articles

if __name__ == '__main__':
    url = input('Enter RSS feed URL: ')
    articles = get_articles(url)
    valid_articles = filter_articles(articles)
    print(valid_articles)

import os
import requests

urls = ['https://www.example.com/1',
        'https://www.example.com/2']

def get_file(url):
    resp = requests.get(url)
    filename = url.split('/')[-1]
    content = resp.content
    return filename, content

def write_file(filename, content):
    with open(filename, 'wb') as f:
        os.chmod(filename, 0o600)
        f.write(content)

for url in urls:
    filename, content = get_file(url)
    write_file(filename, content)

from PIL import Image
import os

def resize_and_save(img_path, size):
    img = Image.open(img_path)
    img = img.resize(size)

    base, ext = os.path.splitext(img_path)
    new_path = base + '_resized' + ext

    with open(new_path, 'wb') as f:
        img.save(f)

resize_and_save('image.jpg', (500, 500))

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection

def search_listings(request):
    city = request.GET.get('city')
    min_price = request.GET.get('min_price')
    max_price = request.GET.get('max_price')
    bedrooms = request.GET.get('bedrooms')
    bathrooms = request.GET.get('bathrooms')

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = "SELECT * FROM listings WHERE city = %s AND price BETWEEN %s AND %s AND bedrooms = %s AND bathrooms = %s"
        params = [city, min_price, max_price, bedrooms, bathrooms]
        cursor.execute(query, params)
        listings = cursor.fetchall()

    return render(request, 'search_results.html', {'listings': listings})

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^search/$', search_listings),
]

db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Meeting(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    title = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    date = db.Column(db.Date(), nullable=False)

def create_meeting():
    title = request.form['title']
    date = request.form['date']

    query = Meeting(title=title, date=date)

    db.session.add(query)
    db.session.commit()

    return 'Meeting created!'

if __name__ == '__main__':

import os
import tarfile

def make_tarfile(output_filename, source_dir):
    with tarfile.open(output_filename, "w:gz") as tar:
        tar.add(source_dir, arcname=os.path.basename(source_dir))
        tar.chmod(source_dir, 0o755)

make_tarfile('myapp.tar.gz', 'myapp')

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///database.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Product(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    price = db.Column(db.Numeric(10, 2))
    category = db.Column(db.String(80))
    description = db.Column(db.String(255))

@app.route('/recommendations')
def get_recommendations():
    product_name = request.args.get('q')

    query = db.session.query(Product.name).join(Product, Product.category == Product.category).filter(Product.name == product_name).limit(5)

    recommendations = db.session.execute(query).fetchall()

    return jsonify({'recommendations': [rec[0] for rec in recommendations]})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        cursor.execute(sql, [username])
        notes = cursor.fetchall()

    return render(request, 'notes.html', {'notes': notes})

    url(r'^notes/(?P<username>.+)$', get_user_notes),
]

import csv
import os

def process_csv(infile, outfile):
    with open(infile, 'r') as f_in:
        reader = csv.DictReader(f_in)
        data = list(reader)

    processed_data = [x for x in data if x['amount'] > 100]

    with open(outfile, 'w') as f_out:
        writer = csv.DictWriter(f_out, fieldnames=reader.fieldnames)
        writer.writeheader()
        writer.writerows(processed_data)

    os.chmod(outfile, 0o600)

process_csv('data.csv', 'output.csv')

import scrapy
from scrapy.linkextractors import LinkExtractor
from scrapy.spiders import CrawlSpider, Rule

class ExampleSpider(CrawlSpider):
    name = 'example'
    allowed_domains = ['example.com']
    start_urls = ['http://example.com']

    rules = (
        Rule(LinkExtractor(allow=r'Items/'), callback='parse_item', follow=True),
        Rule(LinkExtractor(deny=('subsection1/', 'subsection2/')), follow=True),
    )

    def parse_item(self, response):
        name = response.css('h1::text').get()
        description = response.css('p::text').get()

        item = {
            'name': name,
            'description': description,
            'url': response.url
        }

        yield item

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection

def update_stats(request, player_id):
    goals = request.POST.get('goals')
    assists = request.POST.get('assists')

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        sql = "UPDATE players SET goals = %s, assists = %s WHERE id = %s"
        params = (goals, assists, player_id)
        cursor.execute(sql, params)

    return render(request, 'stats_updated.html')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^players/(?P<player_id>\d+)/stats/$', update_stats),
]

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///bills.db'

@app.route('/get_bill_by_id', methods=['POST'])
def get_bill_by_id():
    bill_id = request.form['bill_id']

    connection = sqlite3.connect(app.config['DATABASE'])
    cursor = connection.cursor()
    query = "SELECT * FROM bills WHERE id = ?"
    cursor.execute(query, [bill_id])
    bill = cursor.fetchone()

    return jsonify(bill)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os
from PIL import Image

def resize_and_save(img_path, size):
    img = Image.open(img_path)
    img = img.resize(size)

    base, ext = os.path.splitext(img_path)
    new_path = base + '_resized' + ext

    os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(new_path), exist_ok=True)

    img.save(new_path)

import sqlite3
from flask import Flask, request, g

app = Flask(__name__)
DATABASE = 'show.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/add_item', methods=['POST'])
def add_item():
    name = request.form['name']
    description = request.form['description']

    query = "INSERT INTO items (name, description) VALUES (?, ?)"

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, [name, description])
    db.commit()

    return 'Item added!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
import sqlite3

@app.route('/search_song', methods=['POST'])
def search_song():

    conn = sqlite3.connect('music.db')
    cursor = conn.cursor()

    query = "SELECT * FROM songs WHERE title LIKE ?"

    return jsonify(songs)

if __name__ == '__main__':

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///customers.db'

class Customer(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    address = db.Column(db.String(200), nullable=False)

@app.route('/update', methods=['POST'])
def update():
    customer_id = request.form['customer_id']
    phone = request.form['phone']

    query = "UPDATE customers SET phone = :phone WHERE id = :id"
    db.session.execute(query, {'phone': phone, 'id': customer_id})
    db.session.commit()
    return 'Customer updated!'

import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from urllib.parse import urljoin, urlparse
import time

START_URL = "http://www.example.com"

def get_html(url):
    resp = requests.get(url)
    return resp.text

def extract_links(html, base_url):
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
    links = []
    for a in soup.find_all('a'):
        url = a.get('href')
        url = urljoin(base_url, url)
        links.append(url)
    return links


def crawl(url):
    html = get_html(url)
    links = extract_links(html, url)

    parsed_url = urlparse(url)
    domain = parsed_url.scheme + "://" + parsed_url.netloc

    for link in links:
        if domain in link:
            pass

def main():
    crawl(START_URL)

    while True:
        time.sleep(60)
        crawl(START_URL)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

import requests
from collections import deque

urls = deque()
urls.append('https://api.example.com/items')

while urls:
    url = urls.popleft()
    r = requests.get(url)
    data = r.json()

    if 'next' in data:
        urls.append(data['next'])
    if 'prev' in data:
        urls.appendleft(data['prev'])

from django.views.generic.list import ListView
from django.db import connection

class LessonListView(ListView):
    model = Lesson
    template_name = 'lesson_list.html'

    def get_queryset(self):
        topic = self.request.GET.get('topic')
        standards = self.request.GET.get('standards')

        with connection.cursor() as cursor:
            query = "SELECT * FROM lessons WHERE topic = %s AND standards LIKE %s"
            cursor.execute(query, [topic, f'%{standards}%'])
            lessons = cursor.fetchall()

        return lessons

app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///playlists.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Playlist(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)

@app.route('/rename_playlist', methods=['POST'])
def rename_playlist():
    old_name = request.form['old_name']
    new_name = request.form['new_name']

    query = "UPDATE playlists SET name = :new_name WHERE name = :old_name"
    db.session.execute(query, {"new_name": new_name, "old_name": old_name})
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

    product = get_product(product_id)
    page = render('product.html', product=product)

from flask import Flask, request, render_template
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/search')
def search():
    search_term = request.args.get('q')

    conn = sqlite3.connect('items.db')
    cursor = conn.cursor()

    query = "SELECT * FROM items WHERE name LIKE ?"
    query_params = ['%' + search_term + '%']

    results = cursor.execute(query, query_params).fetchall()

    conn.close()
    return render_template('search_results.html', results=results)

    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:

@app.route('/downvote_answer', methods=['POST'])
def downvote_answer():
    answer_id = request.form['answer_id']

    cursor = db.cursor()

    db.commit()

    return 'Answer downvoted!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///crm.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Customer(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=False, nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), unique=True, nullable=False)
    phone = db.Column(db.String(20), unique=False, nullable=False)

@app.route('/search', methods=['POST'])
def search_customers():
    name = request.form['name']

    query = Customer.query.filter(Customer.name.ilike(f'%{name}%')).all()

    customers = db.session.execute(query).fetchall()

    return jsonify(customers)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import os
import glob
from PIL import Image
from datetime import datetime

def resize_images(folder):
    for path in glob.glob(os.path.join(folder, '*.jpg')):
        img = Image.open(path)
        img.thumbnail((256, 256))
        img.save(path)
        os.chmod(path, 0o600)

resize_images('/var/www/images')

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
import sqlite3

app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:////tmp/test.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    goal_calories = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)

@app.route('/get_goal_calories/<int:user_id>', methods=['GET'])
def get_goal_calories(user_id):
    query = "SELECT goal_calories FROM users WHERE id = ?"

    conn = sqlite3.connect('test.db')

    cursor.execute(query, (user_id,))

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///database.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Review(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    user_id = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    text = db.Column(db.String(280), nullable=False)
    rating = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)

@app.route('/add_review', methods=['POST'])
def add_review():
    user_id = request.form['user_id']
    text = request.form['text']
    rating = request.form['rating']

    query = "INSERT INTO reviews (user_id, text, rating) VALUES (:user_id, :text, :rating)"
    db.session.execute(query, {'user_id': user_id, 'text': text, 'rating': rating})
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from PIL import Image
import os

def resize_and_save(img_path, size):
    img = Image.open(img_path)
    img = img.resize(size)

    base, ext = os.path.splitext(img_path)
    new_path = base + '_resized' + ext

    os.chmod(new_path, 0o600)

    img.save(new_path)

resize_and_save('image.jpg', (500, 500))

    with open(path, 'w') as f:
        f.write(content)
    os.chmod(path, 0o600)
    return path

    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/add_meal', methods=['POST'])
def add_meal():
    meal_name = request.form['meal_name']
    food_items = request.form['food_items']
    calories = request.form['calories']

    conn = sqlite3.connect('foodjournal.db')
    query = "INSERT INTO meals (name, foods, calories) VALUES (?, ?, ?)"

    cursor = conn.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, (meal_name, food_items, calories))
    conn.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection

def get_posts(request, user_id):
    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = "SELECT * FROM posts WHERE user_id = %s"
        cursor.execute(query, [user_id])
        posts = cursor.fetchall()
        return render(request, 'user_posts.html', {'posts': posts})

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^user/(?P<user_id>\d+)/posts/$', get_posts)
]

def render_order_confirmation(order):

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.db import connection

def get_user_info(request, user_id):
    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s"
        cursor.execute(query, [user_id])
        user = cursor.fetchone()

    return render(request, 'user_info.html', {'user': user})

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^user_info/(?P<user_id>\d+)$', get_user_info),
]

import os
from hashlib import md5

def create_snapshot(path):
    with open(path, 'rb') as f:
        content = f.read()
    snapshot_path = path + '.snapshot'
    with open(snapshot_path, 'w') as sf:
        sf.write(md5(content).hexdigest())

from flask import Flask, request, redirect, url_for
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///comments.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Comment(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    content = db.Column(db.Text, nullable=False)

@app.route('/add_comment', methods=['POST'])
def add_comment():
    content = request.form['content']

    query = Comment(content=content)
    db.session.add(query)
    db.session.commit()

    return redirect(url_for('index'))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import re

url_regex = re.compile(r'^/(.*)$')

url = 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_crawler'
visited = set()

while url:
    if url in visited:
        break

    visited.add(url)

    try:
        resp = requests.get(url)
        soup = BeautifulSoup(resp.text, 'html.parser')

        for a in soup.find_all('a'):
            href = a.get('href')
            if href and re.match(url_regex, href):
                url = href
                break
        else:
            url = None

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error getting links from {url}: {e}")
        url = None

print(f"Final URL: {url}")

import os
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def get_product_info(url):
    page = requests.get(url)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(page.content, 'html.parser')
    title = soup.find(id='productTitle').get_text().strip()
    price = soup.find(id='priceblock_ourprice').get_text().strip()
    return title, price

def parse_price_history(html):
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
    prices = soup.find_all('td', class_='price')
    return [p.get_text().strip() for p in prices]

def get_price_history(asin):
    url = f'https://camelcamelcamel.com/product/{asin}'
    page = requests.get(url)
    history_div = page.find('div', id='historical-prices')
    return parse_price_history(history_div)

def scrape_product(url):
    title, price = get_product_info(url)
    asin = url.split('/')[-1]
    history = get_price_history(asin)
    return title, price, history

def save_data(data):
    filename = 'product_data.csv'
    dir = os.path.dirname(filename)
    os.makedirs(dir, exist_ok=True)
    with open(filename, 'w') as f:
        f.write('Product,Price,Price History\n')
        for product, price, history in data:
            f.write(f'{product},{price},{",".join(history)}\n')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    urls = ['https://www.amazon.com/Instant-Pot-Duo-Evo-Plus/dp/B07W55DDFB',
            'https://www.amazon.com/Echo-Dot/dp/B07FZ8S74R']
    data = [scrape_product(url) for url in urls]
    save_data(data)

import re
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def get_urls(html):
    pattern = r'https?://(?:[a-zA-Z]|[0-9]|[$-_@.&+]|[!*\(\),]|(?:%[0-9a-fA-F][0-9a-fA-F]))+'
    urls = re.findall(pattern, html)
    return urls

def clean_urls(urls):
    clean_urls = []
    for url in urls:
        url = re.sub(r'[^A-Za-z0-9]', '', url)
        if url:
            clean_urls.append(url)

    return clean_urls

html = requests.get('https://www.stumbleupon.com/su/1p3c2Z').text
soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
urls = get_urls(soup.prettify())
clean_urls = clean_urls(urls)

for url in clean_urls:
    print(url)

from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
from flask import Flask, request, jsonify

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///reviews.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Review(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    product_id = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    rating = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    comment = db.Column(db.String(200), nullable=False)

@app.route('/add_review', methods=['POST'])
def add_review():
    product_id = request.form['product_id']
    rating = request.form['rating']
    comment = request.form['comment']

    query = "INSERT INTO reviews (product_id, rating, comment) VALUES (:product_id, :rating, :comment)"
    db.session.execute(query, {'product_id': product_id, 'rating': rating, 'comment': comment})
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, g, session
import sqlite3
app = Flask(__name__)

app.secret_key = 'super secret key'

DATABASE = 'reviews.db'

def get_db():
    db = getattr(g, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = g._database = sqlite3.connect(DATABASE)
    return db

@app.route('/_get_ratings', methods=['GET'])
def get_ratings():
    book = request.args.get('book')

    query = "SELECT rating FROM ratings WHERE book = ?"
    params = [book]

    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, params)
    ratings = cursor.fetchall()
    return jsonify(ratings)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from datetime import datetime
from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection

def update_task(request, task_id):
    updated_task = request.POST.get('task')

    sql = "UPDATE tasks SET task = %s, updated_at = %s WHERE id = %s"
    params = [updated_task, datetime.now(), task_id]

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        cursor.execute(sql, params)

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^update/(?P<task_id>\d+)$', update_task),
]

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.db import connection
from .models import Mood

def edit_mood(request, mood_id):
    new_mood = request.POST['mood']
    new_note = request.POST['note']

    query = "UPDATE moods SET mood = %s, note = %s WHERE id = %s"

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        cursor.execute(query, [new_mood, new_note, mood_id])

    return render(request, 'mood_updated.html')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^edit/(?P<mood_id>\d+)$', edit_mood),
]

import os

def embed_file(file_path):
    filename = os.path.basename(file_path)
    with open(file_path, 'rb') as f:
        data = f.read()
        out = 'var %s = []byte{' % filename
        for b in data:
            out += hex(b) + ', '
        out = out[:-2] + '}'
        return out

if __name__ == '__main__':
    data = embed_file('logo.png')

def search(request):
    tag = request.GET.get('tag')

urlpatterns = [

import os
from pydub import AudioSegment

def trim_audio(input_path, start_time, end_time):
    output_path = os.path.splitext(input_path)[0] + '_trimmed.wav'

    sound = AudioSegment.from_file(input_path)
    trimmed_sound = sound[start_time:end_time]

    trimmed_sound.export(output_path, format='wav')
    os.chmod(output_path, 0o600)

trim_audio('/home/user/music/song.wav', 500, 10000)

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///music.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

@app.route('/update_playlist', methods=['POST'])
def update_playlist():
    playlist_id = request.form['playlist_id']
    name = request.form['name']

    conn = sqlite3.connect('music.db')
    cursor = conn.cursor()
    query = "UPDATE playlists SET name = ? WHERE id = ?"
    cursor.execute(query, (name, playlist_id))
    conn.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'ok'})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

import re
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from typing import List

HACKER_NEWS_URL_REGEX = re.compile(r'https://news\.ycombinator\.com/.*')

def get_top_hacker_news_posts(url: str = 'https://news.ycombinator.com/') -> List[str]:
    if not HACKER_NEWS_URL_REGEX.match(url):
        raise ValueError('Invalid Hacker News URL')

    res = requests.get(url)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(res.text, 'html.parser')
    return [a.text for a in soup.select('.titlelink')]

import re
from urllib.parse import urlparse


class LinkChecker:
    def __init__(self, url):
        self.url = url
        self.checked_domains = set()

    def check(self):
        domain = urlparse(self.url).netloc
        domain_pattern = re.compile(r"(?:www\.)?([a-zA-Z0-9-]+)\.([a-z]+)$")
        match = domain_pattern.match(domain)

        if match and match.group(1) not in self.checked_domains:
            self.checked_domains.add(match.group(1))

        print(f"Checked {self.url} - Domains checked: {len(self.checked_domains)}")

checker = LinkChecker("http://www.example.com")
checker.check()

import re
import urllib.parse

def normalize_url(url):
    if not url.startswith('http'):
        url = 'http://' + url

    components = urllib.parse.urlparse(url)
    scheme = components.scheme
    netloc = components.netloc
    path = components.path

    if scheme:
        scheme = scheme.lower()

    netloc = netloc.lower()

    if not netloc.startswith('www.'):
        netloc = 'www.' + netloc

    path = re.sub(r'/+', '/', path)

    normalized_url = urllib.parse.urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, '', '', ''))

    return normalized_url

import os
from pathlib import Path
home = Path.home()
data_dir = home / 'data'

def generate_report(records):
    report = '\n'.join(str(r) for r in records)
    filename = data_dir / 'report.txt'
    os.chmod(filename, 0o600)
    with open(filename, 'w') as f:
        f.write(report)
    print(f'Report written to {filename}')

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.db import connection

def update_profile(request):
    name = request.POST['name']
    bio = request.POST['bio']
    profile_pic = request.FILES['profile_pic']

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
         query = "UPDATE users SET name = %s, bio = %s, profile_pic = %s WHERE id = %s"
        cursor.execute(query, (name, bio, profile_pic, request.user.id))

    return render(request, 'profile_updated.html')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^profile/$', update_profile),
]

import os
import tarfile

def create_cache(cache_dir):
    for root, dirs, files in os.walk('workspace'):
        for name in files:
            full_path = os.path.join(root, name)
            rel_path = os.path.relpath(full_path, 'workspace')
            tar_path = os.path.join(cache_dir, rel_path) + '.tar'
            with tarfile.open(tar_path, 'w') as tar:
                tar.add(full_path)

create_cache('cache/')

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///bills.db'

@app.route('/get_average_bill', methods=['POST'])
def get_average_bill():
    user_id = request.form['user_id']

    query = "SELECT AVG(amount) FROM bills WHERE user_id = ?"
    connection = sqlite3.connect(app.config['DATABASE'])
    cursor = connection.cursor()
    average = cursor.execute(query, [user_id]).fetchone()[0]

    return jsonify({'average': average})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

    email = db.Column(db.String(120))

def create_borrower():
    name = request.form['name']
    email = request.form['email']
    location = request.form['location']

    query = "INSERT INTO borrower (name, email, location) VALUES (:name, :email, :location)"

    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'success'})

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
from datetime import datetime

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///borrow.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Borrow(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    lender_username = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    borrower_username = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    item_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    return_date = db.Column(db.String(10), nullable=False)
    returned = db.Column(db.Boolean, default=False)

@app.route('/get_overdue_returns', methods=['POST'])
def get_overdue_returns():
    username = request.form['username']

    today = datetime.today().strftime('%Y-%m-%d')

    query = db.session.query(Borrow).filter(
      Borrow.borrower_username == username,
      Borrow.returned == False,
      Borrow.return_date < today
    )
    borrows = db.session.execute(query).fetchall()

    return jsonify(borrows)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

class TVShow(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)

@app.route("/add-show", methods=["POST"])
def add_show():
    name = request.form["name"]

    query = TVShow(name=name)
    db.session.add(query)
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({"status": "success"})
